centralQuestion: Should Arkansas invest more heavily in public schools, rather than private school vouchers?

reasons.description: Voucher expansions redirect public funds from public schools and create fiscal externalities and budget uncertainty for districts.

sources.title: Economic Policy Institute: 'How vouchers harm public schools: Calculating the cost of voucher programs to public school districts'
Associated Press: 'Arkansas governor proposes nearly $6.5B budget, with half of spending increase going to vouchers'

reasons.description: Recent research on traditional vouchers shows negative or mixed effects on student achievement, suggesting caution before shifting funds away from public schools.

sources.title: Brookings Institution: 'Research on school vouchers suggests concerns ahead for education savings accounts'
Urban Institute: 'D.C. Opportunity Scholarship Program – Long-term effects overview'

reasons.description: Voucher benefits often skew toward higher-income families and those already enrolled in private schools, raising equity concerns.

sources.title: Brookings Institution: 'Be wary of what you read in the school voucher debate'
Associated Press: 'Parents like private school vouchers so much that demand is exceeding budgets in some states'

reasons.description: Private-school voucher and ESA programs often have fewer accountability requirements than public schools, including weaker testing and reporting rules.

sources.title: RAND Corporation: 'The Path Toward Evaluating the Impacts of Education Savings Accounts on Academic Achievement Outcomes'
Economic Policy Institute: 'State and local experience proves school vouchers are a failed policy that must be opposed'

reasons.description: Rural families often lack nearby private options, so vouchers provide little practical 'choice' while risking disinvestment in rural public schools.

sources.title: Brookings Institution: 'How the Educational Choice for Children Act would benefit the wealthy and underserve rural America'
The Guardian: 'Texas may allow families to pay for private schools with public funds'

objections.description: Parental choice allows families to find the best educational fit for their children.

sources.title: American Enterprise Institute: 'Does School Choice “Work”?'
Hoover Institution: '40 years after “A Nation At Risk,” how school choice policies are reshaping American education'

objections.description: Voucher participation can improve longer-term outcomes such as college enrollment and graduation in some programs.

sources.title: Urban Institute: 'The Effects of the Florida Tax Credit Scholarship Program on College Enrollment and Graduation'
The Economist: 'School-voucher schemes are spreading across America'

objections.description: Vouchers can be more cost-effective than traditional public schooling on a per-pupil basis.

sources.title: American Enterprise Institute: 'What Research Tells Us About School Vouchers' (testimony)
Reuters: 'Texas governor to sign largest US school voucher law, marking conservative shift'

objections.description: Competition from school choice can pressure public schools to improve.

sources.title: The Economist: 'Free to choose, and learn'
Hoover Institution: 'Expand School Choice and Provide Fiscal Relief To Districts'

objections.description: Expanding eligibility beyond only low-income families is argued to be fairer and prevents middle-class exclusion from private options.

sources.title: Hoover Institution: 'Should the Wealthy Benefit from Private-School Choice Programs?'
American Enterprise Institute: 'Implementing K–12 Education Savings Accounts'

research.title: 'School Finance Reform and the Distribution of Student Achievement'
research.description: American Economic Journal: Applied Economics (2018). Event-study evidence shows post-1990 school-finance reforms increased spending and boosted achievement in low-income districts.

research.title: 'The Effects of School Spending on Educational and Economic Outcomes: Evidence from School Finance Reforms'
research.description: Quarterly Journal of Economics (2016). Linking finance-reform-induced spending increases to higher educational attainment and adult earnings; author-accepted manuscript available open access.

research.title: 'School Vouchers: A Survey of the Economics Literature'
research.description: Journal of Economic Literature (2017). Comprehensive review concluding evidence is mixed overall, with some positive findings but insufficient basis for widespread adoption.

research.title: 'The participant effects of private school vouchers around the globe: A meta-analytic and systematic review'
research.description: School Effectiveness and School Improvement (2021). Meta-analysis of RCTs finds modest average achievement effects, varying by context and subject.

research.title: 'The Effects of the Louisiana Scholarship Program on Student Achievement'
research.description: Educational Evaluation and Policy Analysis (2017). Lottery-based study reports negative impacts on voucher users’ math and ELA achievement in early years.
